title: Stranger Things season 4: Hopper theory is as convincing as it is mind-blowing
text:
Stranger Things fan has totally nailed Jim Hopper mystery ahead of season 4 (Picture: Netflix)

A Stranger Things fan has absolutely nailed a theory about the fate of Jim Hopper after his apparent demise at the end of season three.

Taking to Instagram, user @noahschhnapp has deconstructed what they think happened to Hopper – taking into account multi-dimensional string theory, among other things.

They take into account several hints that may have been staring viewers in the face since the first ever season of the streaming juggernaut, hinting that this was always going to happen.

Let us help you break down what might have happened to Hopper, and how it influences both the future and the past of Hawkins.

Hopper basically travelled through time and space at the end of season three

First, the big theory, which is helped with the context of the plot of Christopher Nolan’s Interstellar – which takes a very practical, science-based approach to time travel.

The fan theorises that the explosion during The Battle of Starcourt Mall didn’t actually kill Hopper, instead it transported him in time. The theory links back right to the beginning of Stranger Things, when Mr Clarke explains to the boys how they could (theoretically) rescue Will from the Upside Down.

The show uses the analogy of an acrobat, a tightrope and a flea: Mr Clarke says that our own dimension is a tightrope. An acrobat can only travel forwards and backwards on the tightrope, he can’t go anywhere else because gravity holds him down. But a flea (aka Will, who travelled to the Upside Down) can use the same tightrope in a different way. It can travel up and down, it can basically travel between dimensions.

The theory is, then, that Hopper has now become that flea. The explosion at the Gate dispersed him through time, probably even dimensions, meaning the sheriff can travel between our world and the Upside Down.

The scene in the show is remarkably similar to a scene in Interstellar – which basically boils down to the fact that if our dimension is a straight line on a piece of paper, to travel to another dimension, you have to bend the paper around you and break through to get to the other side.

Hopper has also been manipulating the events of the show in tiny ways, thanks to some stuffed animals

Now, here’s where things get a bit trickier. If we accept that at the end of season three Hopper may have accidentally traveled between dimensions, the fan also suggests that he also travelled through time as well.

A nice example of this – and some handy foreshadowing that’s been staring fans in the face since literally day one – is the appearance of three similar stuffed animal toys, which popped up across different points in time during the show’s history. One is with Will in his cubbyhole in the Upside Down, the other is held by Hopper’s now-dead daughter – who died on cancer before the start of the series – and the third is found in Eleven’s room in Hawkins lab before she escaped.

The fan explains these three toys hint at a connection between the three characters, with the most notable binding factor between the three of them being Hopper. They say this visual link is enough to convince them that Hopper has been travelling through time – and dimensions! – trying to help Will, Sarah and Eleven in small ways, such as helping to comfort them with a cuddly toy.

David Harbour knows what’s happening and is teasing fans on Instagram

The eagle-eyed sleuth that runs this Instagram account also handily tagged a few posts from David Harbour’s official account.

And all this talk about the refraction of light and adding new dimensions now has us pretty much convinced that Harbour has known all along what Hopper’s fate is and he’s basically trolling fans through social media.

The search for answers, however, does continue and won’t actually be solved until Stranger Things drops its fourth season. The good news, however, is that the show has officially been renewed at Netflix, and the sci-fi serial will be returning to the streaming service to answer fan’s burning questions.
